comment.text: Deactivate {{productName}} is used to display a button label in the Portal Settings page, which allows users to deactivate portal access. The translation key appears on a category page where users can manage their account settings.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "قم بإلغاء تنشيط" is a somewhat formal and less natural way to say 'Deactivate' in this context. A more common and user-friendly translation would be "تعطيل" or "إيقاف".

The translation "{{productName}}-i deaktiv edin" is not the most natural way to express "Deactivate {{productName}}" in Azerbaijani. While technically correct, it lacks fluency. A more natural phrasing would be "{{productName}}-i söndürün" or "{{productName}}-i bağlayın".

The Armenian translation "Ապագործունացնել {{productName}}-ը" is not a natural or accurate translation of "Deactivate {{productName}}".  "Ապագործունացնել" is a very uncommon and somewhat awkward verb form. A more common and understandable translation would be something like "չեղծել {{productName}}" or "դադարեցնել {{productName}}".
The word 'deactiveren' is not the standard Dutch word for 'deactivate'. The correct translation is 'uitschakelen' or 'deactiveren' (more literal).

The Polish translation 'Dezaktywuj' is a direct transliteration and doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Deactivate' in a user-friendly way. A more natural Polish translation would be 'Wyłącz' or 'Wyłączenie'.

The Serbian translation 'Деактивирај' (Deaktiviraj) is technically correct but feels unnatural in this context. 'Деактивирај' is an imperative form, suitable for a command. A more natural and user-friendly translation would use a more descriptive phrasing.
